channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Why are rent prices still so high?
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Rent growth is 17% higher than 2021 levels, despite beginning to moderate in September, according to Rent. In other words: Rental prices could be cooling off, but the official CPI data doesn’t reflect this. Rep. Ro Khanna, a Democrat from California, introduced a federal bill last October that would strip large investors from snatching up single-family homes for tax incentives. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. If that trend continues, then rent prices might fall in line with real-time inflationary measures. But if BlackRock isn’t totally responsible for stubbornly high rent prices, and neither are Airbnb hosts who drill through tasteful architectural details to hang driftwood signs that read “I’M ON LAKE TIME”... ), one other theory has gained steam in the last few years: Investment firms are scooping up homes and constricting supply. But in 2010, as credit and mortgage markets tightened following the pop of the 2008 housing bubble, more than 75% of growth in the market came from renters with incomes of $75,000 or more, according to the Joint Center for Housing Studies of Harvard University. For example, month over month rent growth was 0.5% in March, an improvement from the approximately 0.8% monthly increase we saw in late 2022. Since the pandemic began, housing prices have soared. In the March consumer price index report, rents jumped almost 9% from last year, far outpacing the overall inflation rate of 5%. Some point to spiking mortgage rates driving would-be homeowners into the rental market; others to investment firms scooping up units and limiting the available supply. When asked why renters can’t find a studio under two grand, housing experts and economists often point to one thing: not enough supply.
item.author: Lillian Stone

item.title: Janet Jackson gets hip-checked by the Hawks
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. One night, two queens of pop: Janet Jackson’s rescheduled concert will take place at the same time as the first of Taylor Swift’s three Eras Tour shows in Atlanta at Mercedes-Benz Stadium. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeNo one was counting on the Atlanta Hawks getting booted from the playoffs more than the folks who run the team’s stadium—and maybe Janet Jackson. —ML
item.author: Molly Liebergall

item.title: Ed Sheeran’s copyright infringement trial starts
item.description: . The case dates back to 2017, when the family of Ed Townsend—Gaye’s co-writer on “Let’s Get It On”—sued Sheeran for $100 million, alleging that he copy-and-pasted a four-chord progression from the song for his Grammy-winning bop “Thinking Out Loud.” Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. On the one hand…the chord progression does sound almost identical. He won one case and settled another out of court. His defense team claims that there are over a dozen songs that use the same chord progression, including some that predate “Let’s Get It On.”Big picture: Copyright infringement claims have been popping up more frequently in the music industry in recent years. And the plaintiff’s lawyer said a video of Sheeran singing a mashup of the two songs at a concert is the star’s “confession.” —MM
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Disney takes DeSantis feud to the next level
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe battle between Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis and one of the state’s largest employers is getting hotter than the final plate in the Hot Ones Challenge. Disney filed its suit almost immediately after the board hand-picked by DeSantis to govern the district voted to nullify land use agreements made by the previous Disney-controlled board. Back before Disney’s CEO called out the governor in front of investors and DeSantis threatened to build a prison next to Disney World, Disney benefited from Florida’s business-friendly climate. Disney and DeSantis have been dueling like Peter Pan and Captain Hook ever since the company criticized the so-called “Don’t Say Gay” law last spring, and yesterday Disney sued DeSantis, claiming he orchestrated a campaign of retaliation against the company for exercising its free speech rights. The feud hinges on control of the special district where Disney World sits. —CC The suit notes that its existing contracts with the state of Florida would invest $17 billion in Disney World and create 13,000 jobs over the next decade. From a spoonful of sugar to a 74-page lawsuitDisney’s suit accuses DeSantis of a “relentless campaign to weaponize government power against Disney in retaliation for expressing a political viewpoint.”
item.author: Cassandra Cassidy

item.title: A tale of 2 prime-time stars flaming out
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. It was one of the top shows on cable news, regularly drawing more than 3 million nightly viewers. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. It’s not entirely surprising: Tucker Carlson Tonight was as synonymous with Fox as Law & Order is with NBC. ’s market value dropped after news of his departure broke.
item.author: Cassandra Cassidy

item.title: Corporations charge more and make more
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Consumer giants Kimberly-Clark, Nestlé, and P&G raked in more revenue last quarter after they jacked up prices by about 10%. —SK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Higher sticker prices helped GM add almost $1,800 to its per-car profit in North America and grow its revenue. Looking ahead…execs at companies like Coca-Cola say it’s only a matter of time before they’ll have to stop increasing prices or risk losing customers. Chipotle increased prices and store traffic also increased, the company said. Pepsi’s CFO said its customers have already been opting for cheaper products, and the CEO of McDonald’s told the Financial Times that customers were starting to push back on the company’s beefier price tags.
item.author: Sam Klebanov

item.title: Melatonin gummies give you more Zzzs than you asked for
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. One product even had 347% of the stated amount of melatonin. The study, published in the Journal of the American Medical Association, found that 22 of the 25 melatonin products tested by researchers had inaccurate labels that most often lowballed the amount of melatonin they contained. —CC Meanwhile, in the EU, the UK, Canada, and elsewhere, melatonin requires a prescription. But for kids, higher levels of melatonin can cause health problems. Current US regulations do not require supplement-makers to conduct clinical trials or obtain FDA approval before putting their products on the shelf. Big picture: Industry reps and the FDA agree that the dietary supplement marketplace needs a regulatory overhaul. Pediatricians warn that since melatonin is a hormone, even normal consumption on a regular basis can affect a child’s development in puberty. A study released yesterday showed that the labels on sleepy-time gummies frequently misrepresent the amount of melatonin they contain.
item.author: Cassandra Cassidy

item.title: AI-generated Republican attack ad has some experts worried about AI’s role in 2024 election
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. While political campaigns have used AI tools to help canvass voters for years, recent breakthroughs in generative AI (like ChatGPT, Midjourney, and other programs) have taken the tech to a whole new level of realism. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}.

item.title: More Gen Zers own homes than Gen Xers and millennials did at their age
item.description: . Gen Zers entered a welcoming labor market with high wages, while millennials had to wade through the fallout of the 2008 recession before they were able to establish themselves financially. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. —MM css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! The median house sale price for a Gen Z buyer in the area was $255,000 in 2022…$199,525 less than the average median sale price in the US last year, according to the St. Louis Fed.It also comes down to timing. Looking ahead…with interest rate hikes pushing mortgage rates past 6% this year and supply tightening, Gen Zers may not keep up their homebuying pace. Before all you 30-something renters freak out, most young homebuyers bought in cheap areas and jumped on low interest rates. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeParents will have to go back to criticizing their kids for excessive screen time or killing golf, because not owning a home is no longer an accurate roast.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: After the big chill, California braces for a big melt
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. It won’t happen all at once: Temps over the next few days are forecast to hit the 80s, causing some melt, but the true danger will be when 90-degree days come.
item.author: Molly Liebergall

item.title: Bed Bath & Beyond goes bankrupt, plans to close all of its stores
item.description: . A massive going-out-of-business sale matched only by Toys R Us and Circuit City in the last 15 years, Axios notes. This effort was led by Mark Tritton, a former Target exec who was installed by activist investors in 2019. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Plus, if you’re one of the many individual investors who piled into Bed Bath & Beyond when it was a trendy meme stock last year, you’ll need to take your medicine and move on. Bed Bath & Beyond coupons are getting scrapped, and so are the stores that accept them. What happens next? But when Tritton tried to replicate his Target success at Bed Bath & Beyond, that strategy broke down like a cheap blender. In certain categories like kitchen appliances, brands matter, and shoppers stopped showing up to Bed Bath & Beyond after it swapped out KitchenAid mixers and OXO garlic mincers for its own stuff. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeYou have two days left to remember where you hoarded your 20%-off Bed Bath & Beyond coupons and redeem them. Numerous bad decisions by Bed Bath & Beyond management led to the chain’s demise, but the worst own-goal of all was its pivot to private-label products, or items that were made exclusively for Bed Bath & Beyond.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: SCOTUS upholds access to abortion pills…for now
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Because the brief, unsigned order came in response to an emergency petition, making it part of the court’s so-called shadow docket, where decisions get made quickly and without the benefit of oral arguments. But with the case all but guaranteed to end up back at the high court for a final say eventually, it does not tell us much about what the justices will ultimately decide when it gets there. And it’s going to rage: The matter reached the Supreme Court after a federal judge in Texas yanked the FDA’s approval of the drug. —AR What comes next? Why not? The government quickly appealed to the conservative-leaning US Court of Appeals for the 5th Circuit, which rejected parts of the judge’s decision but still imposed restrictions on the medicine’s availability. Meanwhile, the same day the Texas ruling came out, a Washington federal judge ordered the FDA not to restrict access to the pill in 17 states. The case is scheduled to pick back up with oral arguments at the 5th Circuit on May 17. The Supreme Court’s decision means the status quo will be maintained while that all gets sorted out.
item.author: Abigail Rubenstein

item.title: Bud Light makes changes to its marketing team after calls for boycott
item.description: . Those efforts included a partnership with Dylan Mulvaney, a transgender influencer who promoted Bud Light’s March Madness giveaway on April 1 with a personalized can the company had sent her. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Since Heinerscheid became the first woman ever to lead Bud Light’s marketing last June, she set out to revive the declining brand by appealing to women and younger people. According to Beer Business Daily, Bud Light sales fell 10.7% the week ended April 8, while shares in rival Molson Coors appear to have gotten at least a short-term lift. This partnership did not sit well with many conservatives, who attacked Bud Light for being another corporation that went “woke” by prioritizing inclusivity. What’s Bud Light’s response been? css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeBud Light’s VP of marketing, Alissa Heinerscheid, and her boss, Daniel Blake, were placed on leave following conservative backlash to a recent campaign with transgender influencer Dylan Mulvaney. Kid Rock filmed himself shooting 12-packs of Bud Light, and other conservatives used social media to urge a boycott of the brand.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Is India rising to the top?
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. ) working-age people in India. Zoom out: The UN says that India’s population could start declining in 2047. It’s due to surpass China as the most populous country on the planet this year, according to a UN report released this week. The India “buy” caseIndia has a lot going for it, including a massive labor force. India has already eclipsed its former colonizer, the United Kingdom, as the world’s fifth-largest economy, and it’s projected to nick Germany’s No. 4 spot by 2025, according to the Wall Street Journal. What’s holding India back? —SK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! There are 900 million(! But India also has plenty of homegrown success stories. India’s domination of the global economy is far from guaranteed. India better put on some shades or risk being blinded by the spotlight. And word on the pundit street is that it’s poised to get bigger in another way—by rivaling China and the US as a major economic superpower. It’s paying off: Companies looking to diversify their supply chains away from China have embraced India as an alternative manufacturing hub. And that number is increasing—unlike in most major economies, where an aging population is sapping economic growth. Let’s explore why India’s future looks bright, and some of the obstacles on its path to international economic stardom. Apple recently began assembling its new iPhone in the country, and Volvo signaled it might start building EVs there. Nobel Prize-winning economist Abhijit Banerjee thinks India should look inward before it projects its economic ambitions abroad.
item.author: Sam Klebanov

item.title: Brew Classifieds: Week of April 17
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. PERFECTLY PRINTED 4 UR PALM: Formify will 3D print a mouse that fits the shape of your hand. HELP NEUTER MOSQUITOES: Argentina is dealing with one of its worst dengue outbreaks in years. If you take the deal and order a Bambino pizza (one of the most expensive pies on the menu) every day for an entire year, that’s $9,125 in value (without a tip). The host said he believes they did it on purpose because he didn’t let them cancel the 25-day stay after they reserved it.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Companies are getting office mates to split the rent
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. One solution: Get some corporate roommates by subleasing part or all of their office space to other companies. But that doesn’t work for a company that already has a lease, and it doesn’t give the owner the option of ending the sublease at some point when their own company is big enough to fill all the desks—which Paffmann told the Brew can be one reason companies, like the one he worked with, sublease in the first place. According to Mobley, Publicis has listed their space so one company could take over the whole building, or multiple tenants could divvy it up. Michael Paffmann, CEO of VirgoPR, told Morning Brew his company subleases NYC office space from a larger company for eight employees who go in to work two to three times a week. And while Mobley said timesharing is a trend (and has been for a long time for medical offices), he said, “It doesn’t appear to be a big enough trend in traditional office use to really be moving the needle at this point.” Over 250 million square feet of office space is currently available for sublease. For instance, one company comes in on Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday, while another uses the desks on Wednesday and Friday.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: After the big chill, California braces for a big melt
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. It won’t happen all at once: Temps over the next few days are forecast to hit the 80s, causing some melt, but the true danger will be when 90-degree days come.

item.title: The Twilight Saga is getting a TV revival
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. —ML The Twilight series will compete for ratings glory against two familiar foes with equally devoted fans: a 10-year Harry Potter series on HBO Max and Percy Jackson and the Olympians on Disney+. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe franchise that spawned five movies and countless Edward Cullen cosplays is coming back from the dead for a television reboot.
item.author: Molly Liebergall

item.title: Oakland A’s are the latest team to wake up in Vegas
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. In 2016, Vegas had zero pro sports teams, and Oakland had three. Over the last six years, teams have flocked to Vegas like bachelor parties to the MGM Grand—the city is now home to the Raiders (NFL), Golden Knights (NHL), and Aces (WNBA). —CC css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Cassandra Cassidy

item.title: BuzzFeed shutters its news division
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeBuzzFeed said yesterday it’s shutting down its news operation, BuzzFeed News. Peretti said in an email that the company will focus on areas like its popular quizzes and other content that could potentially be created using AI—in his words, “parts of the business that have demonstrated their ability to add to the company’s bottom line.” css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! The problem: breaking big news didn’t translate to $$$For all its reporting breakthroughs, BuzzFeed News was an expensive venture and didn’t bring in enough revenue to justify its continued existence, Peretti suggested. CEO Jonah Peretti said the cuts were the result of “economic and industry downturns” and the news division’s unprofitability. In the newsroom’s early days, legacy media outlets rolled their eyes at BuzzFeed’s attempts at hard-hitting journalism.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Portrait of a rocket on fire
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Starship’s massive payload capacity and world-record thrust could drive bigger, heavier innovations that wouldn’t be able to fit in existing rockets. The brief flight allowed engineers to gather much-needed data that they’ll use to figure out what went wrong. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}.
item.author: Molly Liebergall

item.title: FBI arrest Tennessee Guardsman for applying to be a hitman
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The business didn’t pan out, but he held onto the domain, hoping that one day someone would buy it, according to The Guardian. In one of many follow-up emails to his application, Garcia allegedly wrote, “I enjoy doing what I do, so if I can find a job that is similar to it, (such as this one) put me in coach!”
item.author: Cassandra Cassidy

item.title: The internet is mad at MillerKnoll CEO for telling employees to ‘leave pity city’ and forget about bonuses
item.description: If there doesn’t seem to be much empathy for C Suite blunders these days, it might be because executive pay has eclipsed worker pay over the past few decades. . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Reading the room, MillerKnoll said the clip was taken out of context and the comment was meant to push employees to focus on hitting the company’s $26 million sales goal. And when being the bearer of bad news gets handled less than delicately, it tends to go viral: whether it’s a CEO laying off staff via mass Zoom meetings or posting a crying selfie about letting employees go. —MM The cool CEO facade is crackingOver the last few years, pandemic bumps and economic turbulence have forced CEOs who once spent most of their days wearing fun sneakers and delivering good news to become the big bad boss. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe internet’s favorite kind of main character popped up this week: a CEO going off script. Especially since it came from someone who, according to Fortune, took home $3.9 million last fiscal year in incentive-based compensation on top of her $1.1 million salary.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Netflix reports less dramatic earnings than a year ago
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Despite the launch of its $6.99 ad tier to attract more users, Netflix added 1.75 million net subscribers, about 500,000 short of expectations. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeExactly one year ago, Netflix dropped the bombshell that it had lost subscribers for the first time in 10 years, leading to a nearly 35% stock wipeout the next day. Soon, it won’t even have its DVD rental service to fall back on. Plus, Netflix’s sports docuseries about golf and tennis intended to build off of its Formula One hit are not remotely close to as popular. —MM Leeches of the family, rejoice!
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Apple Store makes India debut
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. And India is not just becoming a bigger consumer market for Apple products; it’s also making them: The latest iPhone is produced there, and Apple’s main manufacturing partner, Foxconn, recently invested $700 million in an Indian manufacturing facility. Though the notoriously budget-busting iPhone is not the go-to for most Indians, the Apple logo increasingly features in the mirror selfies of India’s middle- and upper classes. —SK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! According to UN data, India’s population will surpass China’s sometime this year, and Apple sees a sea of future customers in India’s more than 600 million smartphone users.
item.author: Sam Klebanov
